        public EditorWidget(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    boolean border,
                    java.lang.String text,
                    java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> isValidText,
                    java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> pushText)
        Creates a widget with a editable text field.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of top-left corner
        y - y-coordinate of top-left corner
        width - width of rectangle
        height - height of rectangle
        border - whether to draw a border
        text - initial text content
        isValidText - function determining if the text content is valid
        pushText - function called when the textbox is deselected

      • attemptDeselect

        public boolean attemptDeselect()
        Attempts to deselect this widget. Succeeds if the text content is valid. If it succeeds the contents are pushed to the event handler.
        Returns:
        whether deselection succeeded

        public boolean handleMouseEvent(int id,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int clickCount)
        Description copied from class: Widget
        Event handler for mouse events
        Overrides:
        handleMouseEvent in class Widget
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the type of event. Can be MouseEvent.MOUSE_PRESSED, MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED or MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED
        x - x-coordinate of mouse event
        y - y-coordinate of mouse event
        clickCount - amount of times clicked (e.g. 1 for normal press, 2 for double-click, ...)
